intro: Eruca drepanensis, commonly known as the Mediterranean wallcress, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has pinnately lobed leaves that are often hairy. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from spring to early summer. The plant is known for its peppery taste and has been used in traditional cuisine and herbal medicine.
